Package core.invoker

Class Invoker

java.lang.Object
core.invoker.Invoker
All Implemented Interfaces:
InvokerInterface, Serializable, Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompositeInvoker
public class Invoker extends Object implements InvokerInterface, Serializable
The Invoker class represents a computing resource capable of executing functions with specified RAM requirements. It implements the InvokerInterface interface and provides functionality for synchronous and asynchronous function invocation. Each instance of the Invoker class is associated with a unique identifier, maximum RAM capacity, and usage statistics.

Note: The constructor is protected to ensure instances are created using the createInvoker(long, int) method.

See Also:
  • Invokable
  • MetricRecollector
  • PolicyManager
  • Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • createInvoker

      public static Invoker createInvoker(long ram, int threads)
      Creates an Invoker with the specified RAM capacity and thread count.
      Parameters:
      ram - The maximum RAM capacity of the Invoker.
      threads - The number of threads to be used by the Invoker's executor service.
      Returns:
      The created Invoker instance, or null if the RAM or thread count is less than or equal to zero.

    • getId

      Returns the unique identifier of the Invoker.

      getId in interface InvokerInterface
      Returns:
      The Invoker's identifier.

    • getUsedRam

      public long getUsedRam()
      Returns the amount of RAM currently in use by the Invoker.
      Specified by:
      getUsedRam in interface InvokerInterface
      Returns:
      The used RAM.

    • getAvailableRam

      public long getAvailableRam()
      Returns the available RAM that can be reserved for function execution. This method is accessed by the policy manager to distribute the invocation load. It represents the difference between the maximum RAM allowed (maxRam) and the currently reserved RAM (reservedRam). To get actual ram being used by the Invoker, refeer to getUsedRam().
      Specified by:
      getAvailableRam in interface InvokerInterface
      Returns:
      The available RAM that can be reserved for execution.

    • reserveRam

      public void reserveRam(long ram)
      Reserves a specified amount of RAM for execution.
      Specified by:
      reserveRam in interface InvokerInterface
      Parameters:
      ram - The amount of RAM to reserve.

      public long getUnusedRam()
      Returns the amount of unused RAM on the Invoker.
      Returns:
      The unused RAM.

    • selectInvoker

      public InvokerInterface selectInvoker(long ram) throws NoPolicyManagerRegistered, NoInvokerAvailable, RemoteException
      Selects the Invoker to execute a function based on the required RAM.
      Specified by:
      selectInvoker in interface InvokerInterface
      Parameters:
      ram - The required RAM for the function execution.
      Returns:
      The selected Invoker.
      Throws:
      NoPolicyManagerRegistered - It will never be thrown.
      NoInvokerAvailable - If there is no Invoker with enough max RAM to execute the Invokable.
      RemoteException - If an exception occurs during RMI communication.

    • invoke

      public <T, R> R invoke(Invokable<T,R> invokable, T args, String id) throws Exception
      Executes a synchronous function passed by reference, applying observers and decorators.
      Specified by:
      invoke in interface InvokerInterface
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of input argument.
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      invokable - The Invokable function to be executed along with its RAM requirement.
      args - The arguments needed by the function.
      id - The identifier of the function.
      Returns:
      The result of the function invocation.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during execution.

    • invokeAsync

      public <T, R> Future<R> invokeAsync(Invokable<T,R> invokable, T args, String id) throws Exception
      Attempts to execute a function asynchronously. If there is no available RAM, it will wait until it gets a notification that it can be executed. If the pool of threads is full, it will also wait.
      Specified by:
      invokeAsync in interface InvokerInterface
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of input argument.
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      invokable - The Invokable function to be executed asynchronously along with its RAM requirement.
      args - The arguments needed by the function.
      id - The identifier of the function.
      Returns:
      A Future representing the asynchronous result of the function invocation.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during execution.

    • shutdownInvoker

      public void shutdownInvoker()
      Shuts down the executor of the Invoker. Must be called when the application finishes.
      Specified by:
      shutdownInvoker in interface InvokerInterface

      Parameters:
      policyManager - The PolicyManager to be set.
      Throws:

    • setDistributionPolicyManager

      public void setDistributionPolicyManager(int size, long ram) throws RemoteException, NoInvokerAvailable
      Does nothing. Needed to implement because the contract specifies it.
      Specified by:
      setDistributionPolicyManager in interface InvokerInterface
      Parameters:
      size - The size parameter for the Distribution PolicyManager.
      ram - The RAM parameter for the Distribution PolicyManager.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication-related exception occurs.
      NoInvokerAvailable - If there is no Invoker available based on the Distribution PolicyManager's strategy.

      Throws:
